"I dropped Sharon and I can't get her back!" Maria said, pointing a Barbie doll floating in the water.

"Who's fault is that?"

"You gotta help me! She's drowning!"

Drowning? A Barbie doll? I had worked as a life guard last summer, and I knew a lost cause when I saw one. "Don't worry, kid. She's not going to drown. She's going to get eaten by sharks."

Sharon jumped in the air, her face turning pale. "No!"

"Duh-dun! Duh-dun!" I said, humming the Jaws theme. "You gotta swim faster, Sharon! Their gaining on you!"

13533212.content:
You heard the sound of the door opening, followed by one of the girls saying with a low voice "Yes, I will do that." The pad-pad on the floor and stairs told you that the girl was barefoot. She walked accross the living room into the kitchen, passing the opening to the wintergarten but not looking over. You could see that this was not Maria but one of her guests. She seemed an inch or two taller than Maria, skinny with shapely legs under the summer dress. The girl had passed the opening quickly but you also spotted noticeable little hills with pronounced summits. A black ornamented choker was around her pale neck.

Pocketing your smartphone you tensed, wondering whether to follow the girl into the kitchen. You heard her pour drinks, the machine running told you it would be freshly made juice. This made you think. Was it not Maria's duty to serve her guests drinks or anything else they required? Maybe the guests felt like home or Maria did not bother. When you heard her footsteps again you chose to let her know you were there. "Hi there." you casually called and rose from your chair. A beautiful young girl wearing nothing but a simple summer dress and a choker looked at you with eyes wide. She was carrying a silver tablet with two large glasses of orange juice. Two? Only two? And next to the glasses was a piece of paper rolled and fixed with a ribbon.

"Excuse me Sir. I was not aware of your presence." She bowed too much, causing you to bite your lips. "May I bring you something to drink?" Completely taken by her presence and kindness (kindness?) you just nodded and said "Orange juice is fine." Obediently she placed one of the glasses on your table, bowed again and left for the kitchen to fix another drink. When the girl left the kitchen you decided to inquire about...who would be left without a drink, or the strange piece of paper
13533212.title: Someone came down

135332121.content:
"What is your name?" The girl turned around and briefly looked into your eyes before looking on the ground. "I am called Sam. My real name is Samantha." In the sunshine you could see that her short hair had a dark blue reflection. Her chest was basically flat which would have been fine for a girl of her age, but little steep puffies protruted painfully visible. The very skinny girl stood there, curtsied and turned around to finish the drink. Taking the silver plate with again two drinks into her hands she looked at you pleading. "I am sorry but I have to bring the drinks to the ladies." And she left, her little tush swining.

"Wait. Wait." You called, the girl stopping dead in her tracks. You almost exposed your spying by asking why there were only two drinks for three girls. How would you know without having spied? Quickly you had to change tactics. "When I arrived Maria seemed to have been in the house and not heard me calling. Are you two on your own up there?" Sam stood motionlessly. "No, Sir, there is another girl in the room. She is - ah - a friend. Her name is Kira." Now it was time to ask. "Who gets left without a drink? Should I get something from the cellar that is missing?" You saw her eyes widen. "Oh no. Everything is fine. The drinks are for the other two girls. I do not require anything." You thought you had her adding "as usual". You pressed on. "Let me take the plate. You are a guest. I will tell Maria that she should be the one who gets you something."

Samantha was now alarmed. "Please let me take it upstairs. It is fine. Please do not tell Maria. She might think that I...that I...." The girl blushed, turned on the spot and speedily went up the stairs. Funny enough, half way up the stairs she looked back smiling, eyes sparkling. Then she went up, knocked on the door, announced something which sounded like "service" and the house went quiet.

Go up and find out more? Or tell Maria in front of the others that you do not like her "guests" working for her, pressing their little game?

I really didn’t know how long I could keep my hands off her though, if she were to visit and act all flirty in a tiny bikini.

However, being a good friend, and being into Alicia at the time (though frustrated that she wasn’t nearly as ticklish as Katie), I figured it would never happen. Midway through her texting barrage, I decided to just call her, and acted like I had finally given in to her request to use our pool for backyard sunbathing.

         “Well, alright”, I finally relented, “You can come over and sunbathe by the pool if you want, Katie.”, but I had other plans in mind for my friend’s ticklish girlfriend. I ran around my house (with everyone thankfully off doing other things for the day) and gathered the implements I’d need to carry out my nefarious plan. There were a hundred factors that could blow my plans. I couldn’t read her eyes since she was wearing sunglasses, but the way she was adjusting her pose so that her fantastic rack was on display, and steering the conversation to the trouble she was supposedly having with Nick, and then even asking how I’d feel about her sunbathing topless, I knew where she was trying to lead things.
